tool.name: SAGA.grid_analysis.5
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArraySOURCE False isArrayDEM False isArrayVALUES True output_data_POINTS $output_data_POINTS output_data_LINE $output_data_LINE name SAGA.grid_analysis.5 SOURCE $SOURCE DEM $DEM VALUES $VALUES prefer $prefer response $response outputType_POINTS $OutputSection_POINTS.outputType_POINTS transmissionMode_POINTS $OutputSection_POINTS.transmissionMode_POINTS outputType_LINE $OutputSection_LINE.outputType_LINE transmissionMode_LINE $OutputSection_LINE.transmissionMode_LINE

param.name: SOURCE
param.label: Source Point(s)
param.help: Point shapefile with source point(s) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml

param.name: DEM
param.label: Accumulated Cost Surface
param.help: Accumulated Cost Surface The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: VALUES
param.label: Values
param.help: Allows writing cell values from additional grids to the output The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_POINTS
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

section.name: OutputSection_LINE
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: This tool allows one to compute least cost path profile(s). It takes an accumulated cost surface grid and a point shapefile as input. Each point in the shapefile represents a source for which the least cost path is calculated.<br/>In case the point shapefile has more than one source point defined, a separate least cost path is calculated for each point. The tool outputs a point and a line shapefile for each least cost path.<br/> The tool allows for optional input grids. The cell values of these grids along the least cost path are written to the outputs as additional table fields.<br/>
